intro: Galpinia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered galpinia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashews and mangoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub with dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, orange-red pulp. Galpinia parviflora is adapted to moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
